items.content:
Parallel Domain (www.paralleldomain.com) | Data Generation Platform for autonomy | Hiring Computer Graphic and Software Engineering Positions | Vancouver, BC, Canada

Normal mode of operation: REMOTE part of the week

5 positions available here: https://jobs.lever.co/paralleldomain

We are a fast-growing startup based in Palo Alto, California. Founded in 2017, we have quickly assembled a world-class team that is already changing the way the industry develops machine learning models. Our platform is a data generation engine that provides our customers with rich labeled sensor data with the turn of a dial.

items.title: Blue Canvas | Senior Engineer | Remote, SF, Berlin | https://bluecanvas.io We make source ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Blue Canvas | Senior Engineer | Remote, SF, Berlin | https://bluecanvas.io

We make source control and DevOps tools for the Salesforce dev ecosystem. We were shocked to learn that Salesforce devs and admins build impressively complex applications without any kind of source control or CI! The market is growing fast as more companies embrace “low code” platforms like Salesforce ($13B was spent customizing Salesforce in 2017).

We’ve reached profitability working with initial customers like Twilio, McKesson and Intercom and recently raised a round from Indie.vc. We admire companies like Basecamp, Mailchimp and Atlassian who grew mostly with customer revenue AND made a significant impact.

We’re looking for experienced full-stack engineers to take a senior role working with our CTO. We are a remote-first company.

We're excited about you if you have experience in some of the following:

- Vue.js, Typescript, Apollo GraphQL - Python 3 - Ruby on Rails, GitLab - AWS, Terraform, Docker

Email jobs@bluecanvas.io if you're interested with the subject line "Interested in engineering at Blue Canvas"

items.title: Glovo is hiring for the Tech team! Co-Vid 19 has made our Grocery section have a HYPERGROWTH! ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=19, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=7, java=21, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Glovo is hiring for the Tech team! Co-Vid 19 has made our Grocery section have a HYPERGROWTH! we need great Tech Team members to provide the best experience and SOLUTION to the world! We are super flexible, start dates can be moved and you can start remote to then move to Sunny Barcelona Office + New Tech Hub in Warsaw Poland! (WFH, full flexibility but Fulltime, full relocation + Sponsorship)At the moment Glovo is the fastest-growing generation 2 (this means that we have our own logistics platform) delivery startup in the world and becoming one of the best Tech Product Start-ups in Spain.

Tech Challenges: Project Valkyrie: Related to the number of deployments per day. Project Darwin: Going from a Monolithic to a Microservices architecture. Better efficiency with Machine Learning.

Tech Stack: Java , Python, Spring Boot, Redis, Python, NodeJS, AWS (SQS, Kinesis, Aurora,EC2, Lambda,Cloudwatch, Jenkins, Terraform, Ansible, Github Actions, Spinnaker, DataDog Mobile: Java, Kotlin, Swift Frontend: JavaScript, Vue.js

Key Job Openings:

Engineering Manager, Senior ML Engineer, Senior Backend Engineers, Senior Android Engineers, Senior iOS Engineers, Site Reliability Engineers, SDET, Senior Backend Engineers - Platform Services

https://jobs.glovoapp.com

If you write to me I will guide you through the process faster!

gianluca.rosania@glovoapp.com

I’m attaching our corporate video: https://youtu.be/1lnZ8xsx9bE

;)

items.title: HR - Subject Matter Expert
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
At You Intrapreneur (https://www.youintrapreneur.com/) we teach people how to become corporate entrepreneur to advance their career within their organization or outside their organization.


We want to build the workforce of the future raising CEO alike profiles who are able to lead at every level of their company, who have a broad range of competences, and can go deep and/or broad to solve problems and build solutions. 


Our students' motto is: "you don't need to be a CEO to work as a CEO!".


We are looking for a HR - Subject Matter Expert to build our HR chapter and improve our knowledge program.


This is a key chapter we want to develop to offer competitive advantage to our clients.


We want our clients to learn how HR teams identify emerging talent, what a "killer" personal brand is, how to best handle your compensations & benefits negotiation.


Responsibilities:



  • identify critical elements to know of a HR function and how to leverage those insights to get the most out of your career

  • identify business cases to facilitate the learning experience

  • summarize practical tips that you can share from your career experience in HR

  • write content material

  • work with the rest of the team to support with marketing activity (contribute to Webinars, articles, LinkedIn, etc)


What you'll have back:



  • the possibility to contribute developing future leaders and "give back" with your knowledge

  • you'll be part of a team, virtually meet other experts to expand your network

  • add a new experience on your CV and join our community of Advisers once everything goes back to normal

  • access coaching sessions for free


 


Please note this is a volunteer role for people in furlough

items.title: Technical Talent Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
WHAT WE WANT


UTOPICODE is currently looking for a specialist that is responsible for screening software developers on a technical level to meet the technical requirements of London’s tech companies. This profile would design and apply programming tests and tasks to validate the technical level of developers and ensure their seniority level.


 ABOUT THE COMPANY


 UTOPICODE is the platform that will transform the way remote tech talent is recruited. We want to be the first option for companies that wish to recruit remote and skilled tech talent from the LATAM region. UTOPICODE is an early-stage start-up and the founding team is currently developing the Minimum Viable Product to achieve product- market fit. Being part of the team at this early stage gives profiles the opportunity to have hands-on decision making within the company and great opportunities of career growth.


 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and perform live programming tests to evaluate fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.), software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing, source control, APIs etc.), and/or specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.)

  • Prepare task briefs for coding tests that show real challenges and practical problems that they would encounter in a company.

  • Observe the candidate’s logic, their ability to explain what they are doing, how they think and their ability to code under pressure.

  • Revise and screen developer’s repositories in their IDE’s (Integrated Development Environment)- GitHub, Google, Stack Overflow.

  • Perform pre-screening calls to analyse the developers’ technical knowledge and minutia.

  • Test different technical assessment platforms to analyse its integration to UTOPICODE’s recruiting tools.

  • Create and monitor the performance metrics of each candidate at a technical level.

  • Iterate technical assessments based on experience, developers feedback and customer’s needs.


OFFER



  • This position is paid by candidate’s examination.

  • This is a remote position with flexible office hours.

  • A cool workspace is provided at Google for Startups campus/ East London.


 REQUIREMENTS



  • Experienced full-stack developer.

  • Experience in designing and applying pre-screening tests for engineering teams.

  • Great communication skills.

  • Ability to empathize with candidates and provide feedback.

  • Flexibility and adaptability to changes implied in an early stage start-up environment.
